books.title: The First Men in the Moon
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: Two British men become the first humans to reach the Moon.

books.title: The Blue Lagoon
books.author: H. de Vere Stacpoole
books.summary: After a shipwreck, two surviving children are stranded on an island paradise, experiencing its bounties and resources, facing the dangers of the natural world, and undergoing their own maturation and romance.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: The School for Scandal
books.author: Richard Brinsley Sheridan
books.summary: Despite their best efforts, the rumormongers of 18th-century London are disappointed by their targets.

books.title: He Who Gets Slapped
books.author: Leonid Andreyev
books.summary: A mysterious gentleman joins a circus troupe as a clown.

books.title: Peter and Wendy
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A mischievous and cocky young boy, Peter Pan, takes Wendy and her brothers on adventures on a fantasy island consisting of mermaids, pirates, Native Americans, and fairies.

books.title: Noli Me Tangere
books.author: José Rizal
books.summary: After years away studying in Europe, a man returns to his hometown in the Philippines, and plans to build a school for the improvement of the local population.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: Up from Slavery
books.author: Booker T. Washington
books.summary: The autobiography of Booker T. Washington, former slave and founder of the Tuskegee Institute.

books.title: The Borough Treasurer
books.author: J. S. Fletcher
books.summary: When a retired detective is found murdered, two business partners in a small Yorkshire town become the prime suspects.

books.title: The Public and Its Problems
books.author: John Dewey
books.summary: A discussion of the political philosophy of a democratic society.

books.title: Some Thoughts Concerning Education
books.author: John Locke
books.summary: John Locke outlines his philosophy of childhood education.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Charles Beaumont
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Charles Beaumont.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Aleksandr Kuprin
books.summary: A collection of Aleksandr Kuprin’s translated short stories, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Pursuit of God
books.author: A. W. Tozer
books.summary: A. W. Tozer’s classic work on Christian living, containing practical advice for those who wish to know God, not simply know about Him.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.
